title: How to get free government cell phone with internet - Quora

response.answer_text: Be exceedingly poor and don’t expect to use the internet much. The program is called “lifeline”, as is intended to make sure poor people have ready access to medical services. Do you qualify for Medicaid or SNAP? Is you income less than 135% of the poverty line? Then you can get a free phone provided by the carrier, a monthly quota of voice minutes, a monthly quota of data, and unlimited texts. Contract details vary, depending on what company you get your “lifeline” service from. You must renew annually, which mean proving that you still qualify.

You don’t say which government represents you, but from your name I’m guessing it’s the Indian government. In ‘Digital India,’ Government Hands Out Free Phones to Win Votes gives one example of how free phones are distributed. There are a few websites that offer free phones as a reward to people who sign up and then do things to generate reward points. You could try those (google “free phones”), but historically, free giveaways on the Internet always have a downside / catch.
